TopicTitle: my pile of debris [still a lo to add]

Articles.Content:
so today i was playing ksp, everything just normal, just launched a new probe destined to minmus, i did land it but then i discovered part of the trasnfer stage had impacted relativelty close to the landed and some parts survided, just a fuel tank nothing out od the ordinary, but then it came to my mind, what sorts of debris will be around my system floating without me knowing about? so today i started the debris search. searching for the most interesting crap i could find, theres a lot out there so expect some updates really soon! get ready:

----THE TRANSFER STAGE----

this saturn v-esque -slightly based on the S-IVB-object capted my attention mainly because of two things, first it mass and second, it still had some fuel! sadly it not usable, there were other parts attached radially to the tank because i remember crashing the whole ship , but the core probre got destroyed and i lost track of most parts, i still cant believe i didn't see something that big

those are not farings, its conic fuselages i was testing the rocket capabilities C:

----THE WRECKED SHIP----

now don't know if i can consider this one as debris, it stills shows up at the tracking station, and its still functional if a kerbal its piloting it, but theres no way to get it out of there, its stuck,believe, i tried a lot, anyway the story is simple, i tried to land on the dark side, got distracted for a second and didn't see the radar altitude managed to avoid crash but ship ended turned sideway, i sended the exact same ship to rescue it and everybody returned safe with their happy families

flag was planted by rescue team

----THE ESCAPE TOWER THAT ESCAPED----

now most of the debris i got is decoplers that end up in the same trajectories that my mun landers when i try to dock the command module with the landet and i have to separate the CSM engone with the landers docking port, but this got me surprised, a escape tower in a really high orbit! normally i jettison them after first stage sep, but this really got me curios, how it endend up su high? i must send a shuttle to recover it, museums will kill each other for it

----MUN'S LANDER 2.0 AFTERMATH----

so yeah, i redesigned the lander , this is mostly a bonus pic, because im mostly aware that after lifoff the landing stage remains where it landed, but it makes a pretty picture, makes me think how the apollo landing sites may look now

-------------------------------------------

its almost creepy seeing it all empty

----There's still a lot more to come!-----

Edited December 13, 2013 by thunderstar
Heh, kind of liked the tumbled lander one.
